alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 19 at 3:17AM MDT until May 20 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM MDT FRIDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches up to mountain pass level, with up to 12 inches above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From Noon today to 6 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially on US Highway 89 from Browning to St Mary, US Highway 2 from East Glacier to Marias Pass, and on Looking Glass Road from East Glacier to Kiowa Junction. Hazardous backcountry conditions due to strong winds and wet snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates in excess of 1 inch per hour are likely late this afternoon through this evening, especially in the mountains and along the immediate foothills of the Rocky Mountain Front.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
